PhaseEvent2: ^Thank you for calling TPS, how can I help?
^Titan Public Safety. Who am I speaking with?

c-1: ^Perfect, just who I needed to talk to.
c-2: ^My name is Roy Estrada. I'm the captain of the Redliner.
^It's nice to meet you, Captain Estrada.

c-0: ^Please, call me Roy. I'm calling to report an issue.
c-1: ^And you. Now if you could help us out.
c-2: ^Thank you, we just crossed into sector 6 not but two hours ago. It seems like Titan's slow this time of year.
^Quite. Now, what appears to be the issue?

c-1: ^Well, fortunately, I have something for you to do.
c-2: ^I'm not sure if you said anything, but...

c-3: ^Hmph. Well, let me get into it.

b: ^I guess I'll try calling back later.

g-0: ^Looks like this old girl has run into some problems. Our primary engine is building up pressure even after our engineer ran through our system diagnostics...
^I trust he knows what he's doing, but could you help him out?

c-8: ^Hello? My communication may be spotty, but anyways...

g-1: ^I'll pass communications over to Aaron, but I'll be standing nearby if you need any help.
^Uh... Hello? Can you hear me? This is Aaron Bedford.

c-9: ^You... you as well. Let me tell you what's happening...
c-10: ^Oh, hello! Let me tell you what's happening...

g-2: ^Well, um, I ran through the primary engine checklist.
^Nothing is seriously wrong, but I know I probably messed something up. The temperature keeps rising and it won't go down.
^It says to call you in case of emergency, and well, I didn't want to take any chances, you know?
^Okay, Aaron. First, tell me the engine's ID code.
^What's the ID code of your engine?
g-3: ^Oh, right! Give me a minute here...

c-20: ^Oh, thank you. Uh, well, I'll wait here...

PE2A: ^From this report, it looks like the emission valves are closed.
^Hey, Aaron, it looks like the ventilation stopped working.
^Hmm, looks like the CO2 levels are clogging the alternator.
^This it may be the secondary pistons.

c-0: ^Um... nothing is hapening, the temperature is the same.
c-2: ^Um... nothing is hapening, the temperature is the same.
c-3: ^Um... nothing is hapening, the temperature is the same.
g-0: ^Well, it looks good over here so far. Thank you so much! Have a good night!
^Hi, call me Harper. Got another problem for you.
^Annoying-ass feedback is coming over the intercom system.
^Estrada sent Bedford into the Communications Room. We need help, can you do it?
^What am I going to do, leave?

c-3: ^I just needed to know you could hear me so

g-1: ^Check our map file and tell me which intercom box is broadcasting.

g-0: ^Th-this is Sunny speaking. I mean, uh, Sunny du Vois speaking. Acting ph-physician and medic on the Red Liner.
^We seem to have a m-major problem here!
g-1: ^Aaron is hurt! He turned the Intercom off, b-but it shocked him.
^I patched him up. He's stable but in pain. R-Roy and I are with him in the, uh...
^Infirmary! Could you please call medical dispatch?!
^By the time you get a word out?

PE3B: ^Please give me the ships ID signature so we can transpond to their location.

c-0: ^Perfect, I see them. We're on our way!
^Just tell them to sit tight, and we'll contact you once we reach them. Good Day.
c-1: ^Give it to me one more time; we're going to need the right code.
c-2: ^Give it to me one more time; we're going to need the right code.
c-3: ^Give it to me one more time; we're going to need the right code.
c-4: ^Hello? I can't hear you. Please give me the ship's ID signature.

c-0: ^Cargo flattened his chest when our ship went sideways.
^I need y-Damnit Sunny! Get Bedford out of here!
g-0: ^One of the engines blew in the jolt. It crashed our energy shields.
^If it happens again without that shield, we're done. Get it up with me, now.
^The screaming makes it hard to concentrate.
^I made it to the bridge. It looks sketchy in here.
^Fuck. Okay, listen. I know how to fix this.
^I just need your help rerouting some of the power back to the shields.
^If you say so, let me get the file.
^Works for me. I'll be right back.

c-5: ^Good. You have a shield map, don't you?
c-8: ^Hey! This isn't the time to be slacking!
^Just... Check whatever files you have and get back to me.

PE4B: ^Harper, I'm back. I need the ship model number.
^I need your ship model number, now!

c-3: ^Useless, what do you need? The model number?
g-0: ^This junk is an Argon Albatross Mk III.
^Oh, is it now? I couldn't tell.

PE4C: ^Alright, so I need to input something?

g-0: ^...Nothing's happening. Are you sure this is right?
^Try again. Just read it out slo-
^It could be these buttons, not your inputs.

c-8: ^Is that what you said the first time? It's not working.

g-3: ^We should be in the clear now. I'm going to stabilize the electromagnetic field.
^Before you go, I need on more thing. Encrypt our communication.
^I know it sounds crazy, but I'm not risking anything.

PhaseEvent5: ^I'm just-I'm tired of this shit. I'm losing my patience.
^What if... what if this is an outside attack?
^I don't know... Take precaution with me.
^Let me get access to our Executive Office.
^If you say so, I'll get into the Exec Office.

c-3: ^Talk to me dammit! My patience is wearing thin.

choice: ^Hm. Okay, I can help. Give me station's routing number and firewall code.
^Sure, let me get that for you.

c-2: ^Okay, thanks. Let me... let me just get in here...

g-0: ^Okay, let’s begin. Not sure if you’ve done this before, because I haven't either. I do know the first step however.
^Hurry up, I'm not getting in trouble for this.

c-3: ^Hey, I see something stuck up your ass, might want to get it out.
c-4: ^Hey, I’m currently trying to save our skin, not sure if you noticed.

g-1: ^First thing is your station’s Audio Frequency Routing Number, this will let me target and encrypt anything coming from your station.
g-4: ^Okay, first part is done. But I'll be straight up with you, I’m not sure what to do next. You’re the responder, find the answer.
g-6: ^Hey Harper, to keep going I need your own AFRN and Audio Manager ID.
^Looks good on my end, I’ll need your AFRN and Audio Manager ID to continue.
^Listen up, I need your AFRN and Audio Manager ID to do this.

c-19: ^Who do you think you're speaking to!?

g-8: ^Right. I know our AFRN is 5849, but I don’t know the Audio Manager ID. Call Aaron, he should’ve calmed down by now.
^Okay, I'll call him, see you soon.
^Sounds good, see you in a bit.
^Good, I’m getting tired of you too.
g-10: ^Um….Hello? Sorry, I forgot how to use this thing. How can I help you?
g-11: ^The Captain…..he’s gone. A loose crate crushed his chest when the shuttle first shook. It’s……………..all my fault……….I didn’t double check our cargo. I’m so sorry….
^Aaron listen to me, it's okay, we’ll fix this.
^He was old, it was bound to happen.
g-12: ^Truth is…...I didn’t know how to secure the cargo like he asked. I didn’t want to embarass myself, so I lied……. Please let me help you, I have to make amends, what do you need me to do.
^Listen to me, we’ll get through this. I need the Audio Manager ID to fix this.
^Aaron, it wasn’t your fault, let me have the Audio Manager ID so we can fix this.
^Kid, just give me the Audio Manager ID.

c-34: ^Yes, I can do this. We can do this.
c-37: ^I don’t mean to be needy, but please respond to me….

g-13: ^Okay……………...one minute, I’m going to grab my booklet, it's got all my notes in it……………………………………..got it! One second please, I’m finding the page right now………………..oh! It’s 84T3-FCAD.

MidPhaseEvent2: ^Hey! How’d it go? Please tell me it worked.
^Yeah it worked, just sent it a few seconds ago.

c-0: ^Thank you….you dont know how much that means.

g-1: ^Yeah it worked, just sent it a few seconds ago.
g-2: ^Um, h-hey! I really hope it worked, please tell me good news.
^Yeah it worked, just sent it a few seconds ago.

c-8: ^Oh! That’s excellent...I-I’m so proud of him!

g-3: ^While you were gone, I remembered something! After anything like this we need to run a diagnostic scan. The problem is...I haven't been able to fix the servos in the Bridge to do so.
^No problem, we can do it together.
^Let me do it, I’ll just need your help.
g-4: ^We need to run a scan. Shuttle has taken some damage both internal and external, no telling what’s going to happen to it.
^No problem, we can do it together.
^Let me do it, I’ll just need your help.
g-5: ^W-well um….we should really r-run a scan! You never know until you run a s-can afterall! Please can we run it?
^No problem, we can do it together.
^Let me do it, I’ll just need your help.
g-6: ^Alright, the scan is underway; you’ll have to retrieve the results from your end.
^Scan is started, though the results will be sent to your end when it's done.
^Started the scan, wait for the results, they’ll come to you.
g-8: ^Alright, the scan is underway; you’ll have to retrieve the results from your end.
^Scan is started, though the results will be sent to your end when it's done.
^Started the scan, wait for the results, they’ll come to you.
g-9: ^Alright, the scan is underway; you’ll have to retrieve the results from your end.
^Scan is started, though the results will be sent to your end when it's done.
^Started the scan, wait for the results, they’ll come to you.
g-10: ^Hey! Something is happening, the ship just jerked again! This time I heard a loud noise...do you want me to go, or should someone else while I stay at the bridge to handle the scan results?
^No, stay at the bridge; I'll call someone else.
^Yes, go to the noise, tell Harper to go wait at the bridge for the scan.
^Yes, go investigate the noise, tell Sunny to watch the bridge for the scan.

c-36: ^Right! I’ll do whatever you need me to.
c-39: ^W-what do you want me to do!?

g-12: ^Something’s wrong. I can feel it. We jerked again, there was another crash. Either I go look or someone else does, make the call.
^No, stay at the bridge; I'll call someone else.
^Yes, go to the noise, tell Harper to go wait at the bridge for the scan.
^Yes, go investigate the noise, tell Sunny to watch the bridge for the scan.

c-43: ^Look. We have no time for this bullshit, respond to me.

g-13: ^We’ve got a real p-problem here! The s-ship jerked again! There was another loud b-boom! Please tell me what to do, should I s-stay at the bridge or g-go look!?
^No, stay at the bridge; I'll call someone else.
^Yes, go to the noise, tell Harper to go wait at the bridge for the scan.
^Yes, go investigate the noise, tell Sunny to watch the bridge for the scan.

c-45: ^Um okay! I’ll go right now and tell Harper w-when I’m there!

MidPhaseEvent3: ^O-okay. I can do that. I’m heading there right now…………………….………looks to be more engine trouble………………..…..let me………...…..oh no! The engine power is failing. It’s falling quickly, they’re gonna rupture if we cant pull them back!

g-1: ^Good idea. I’ll look. Sounds like the engine room, not much else can make that noise on this side of the Liner…………………………...………………...Well, fuck. Aaron would know more, but it looks like we have engine failure. The power output is showing red.
g-2: ^Oh! W-well I can go look! Just please stay on the line. It l-looks to me like it's coming from the engine room. I d-don't know as much as Aaron but the power is l-low. We n-need to fix this quickly!!
g-3: ^It looks to me like the spacial carburetors are failing to emit their burnoff, its slowing the engines down. I…..I’m not gonna lie, this is gonna be dangerous, but I can fix it. I need you to tell me what's going on inside the engine.
^Be careful Aaron, I’ll find the engine info.
g-4: ^I know it's a power failure, look at your information. Just tell me what to do. I’ll do it, just don't get me killed.
^Be careful Harper, I’ll find the engine info.
g-5: ^O-okay….um….well it looks bad. It’s giving off low power and it's really hot in here. Just t-tell me what to do please!!
^Be careful Sunny, I’ll find the engine info.
g-6: ^Tell me what the engine output is reading.

c-27: ^My book says you'll need my output...

g-8: ^Tell me what the engine output is reading.

c-31: ^Let me do your job, you need my engine output.

g-9: ^Tell me what the engine output is reading.
g-10: ^Right, I-I already looked, it's reading 241RW, that's low…..too low. It should be near 500RWs……………..I’ll start shutting down the engine.
^Perfect, thank you. Let me know when it’s done.
^Hurry it up kid, another jerk may be happening.
g-12: ^Oh! O-okay! Let me see………...its….its...241RW! Yes! 241RW! W-what do you want me to do next?
g-13: ^It should be shutting down right now…..yeah! I’m gonna give it a second and open the hood.
^Sounds good, tell me what you find.
g-14: ^Roger. Tell me how to do that.
^Find the electrical input and atomic bypass gauges, turn them to 0 slowly, do it together.
^Look for the electrical input and atomic bypass gauges. Turn them off slowly, it has to be together.
^Listen. Find two gauges, electrical input and atomic bypass. Turn them to 0 together.
g-15: ^Oh, okay! W-well, how do I do that?
^Find the electrical input and atomic bypass gauges, turn them to 0 slowly, do it together.
^Look for the electrical input and atomic bypass gauges. Turn them off slowly, it has to be together.
^Listen. Find two gauges, electrical input and atomic bypass. Turn them to 0 together.
g-16: ^Um….this isn’t good. The wiring is intact but the electrical components must’ve lost their connection during the jerking, it then sat against the overheating engine and is fucked.……. Should I try and rewire this?
g-17: ^Okay, next you need to open the engine and find the internal wiring.
^Open the hood, look for the wiring near the core.

c-67: ^Look. I need your help...so give it to me.

g-18: ^O-okay………..here I go………….please...please….please………….I-I think it worked? Y-yeah! Okay, now what?
^Okay, next you need to open the engine and find the internal wiring.
^Open the hood, look for the wiring near the core.
g-19: ^Well, it….it could be dangerous. There’s no doubt the engine is unstable. I’ll do whatever, just let me know.
g-20: ^Wires are fine, electronics look fucked. Want me to rewire the engine….I know 	to do that much at least, spend a lot of time in the bridge.

c-78: ^Are you sure? I think I have too.

g-21: ^W-well! It...um….oh…...it looks like the wires are o-okay…….The circuit boards look pretty f-fried though! S-should I rewire them? It’s l-like s-stitches!
g-22: ^Let me see……..give me a minute………………………………………….got one………………………..make that two……………………..thr-wait……..three. O-okay, I think that’ll work.
g-24: ^Okay. Give me a moment……………………………………….I’ve got one. The next one looks stuck……………………………………………….fuck, I can’t get it. One second……………………………………………..FUCK! The fucking wire is still live! Burned my fucking arm!
^Oh my god, Harper get to Sunny right now!
^Roy died, suck it up. Go see Sunny.
g-25: ^Um okay…….let me see……………………………….this first wire looks okay……………………...s-second one is a bit s-stuck. Um, let me l-look at this third one………………………...OWW! AHH! It burned m-my arm!!
^Oh my god, Sunny, get to your infirmary right now!
^Are you okay!?! Go get to your infirmary.
^Roy died, suck it up. Get your tools.

MidPhaseEvent4: ^H-hey. I just wanted to let you know we’ve got an emergency coming from the Mess Hall, I’ll head there right away.
^Okay, let me know what’s going on.

g-1: ^This shit never ends. Something is going on in the mess hall, on my way.
^Okay, let me know what’s going on.
g-2: ^Why c-cant this all just be over! There’s s-something going on in the mess hall, I’m gonna go there n-now……
^Okay, let me know what’s going on.
g-3: ^Oh my god! Let's put it out!
^Of course there is...let's put it out.
^Which one of you broke an ancient mirror?
g-5: ^There’s a fucking fire in here, how in god’s name did this even start?
^Oh my god! Let's put it out!
^Of course there is...let's put it out.
^Which one of you broke an ancient mirror?
g-6: ^Oh my god! Let's put it out!
^Of course there is...let's put it out.
^Which one of you broke an ancient mirror?
g-7: ^I’m at the fire failsafe…..one second…..I know the code……………..please work…………………………….....it’s not working! You need to override this system, it's locking me out!
^Give me a minute, I'll take care of it.
g-8: ^Okay. I’m at the fire failsafe………...fuck………..shit…..damnit……..it’s not working! Listen, override this junk and let me in!
^Give me a minute, I'll take care of it.
g-9: ^I c-can’t do this! This is all t-too much! Just override the fire failsafe s-system!!!
^Give me a minute, I'll take care of it.
g-10: ^It’s my fault. I took too long.
g-12: ^It’s my fault. I took too long.
g-13: ^It’s my fault. I took too long.
g-16: ^O-oh god you did it! You’re amazing, t-thank you!

MidPhaseEvent5: ^Hey! The fire is dying down, the failsafe activated. Um, another thing, the results just came back from your end...and it……..it doesn’t look good. The ship….it’s falling apart. It says we’ve only got a few minutes before it really starts to begin breaking down…
^Okay, we need to get everyone off the ship.
^We can do this, we need everyone to leave the ship.

g-1: ^Two things. I’ll start with the good. The fire is nearly out, the failsafe is doing its job. Update on the scan results, they’re fucked. This piece of junk is falling apart, it’s got a few minutes before the real tearing apart happens.
^Okay, we need to get everyone off the ship.
^We can do this, we need everyone to leave the ship.
g-2: ^S-so, the fire is almost out! You did a f-fantastic job on the failsafe, it’s killing the f-fire…...but….um…...the scan came back…...and…...w-well…….this shuttle is falling apart…...W-we only have a few minutes before it really starts to tear apart….
^Okay, we need to get everyone off the ship.
^We can do this, we need everyone to leave the ship.
